original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields down at close
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were down at close on Tuesday following a treasury bond auction, while the interbank guidance peg was steady.
A bond maturing on 01.02.2025 closed at 31.70/32.10 percent on Monday, down from 32.10/40 percent on Friday.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 29.25/50 percent, down from 29.50/80 percent on Friday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 which was issued today opened at 29.10/40 and closed at 29.20/30 percent.
The Central Bank’s guidance peg for interbank US dollar transactions appreciated by 17 cents to 362.50 rupees from 362.67 against the US dollar. (Colombo/Feb 27/2023)
